intro: Pilosella kalksburgensis subsp. virenticana, commonly known as the greenleaf hairgrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are generally narrow and hairy, contributing to its common name. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly greenish hue and compact growth habit.
